newsitem.title: USA: EXPEDITORS ADDS CANADA, MEXICO BORDER OFFICES.
newsitem.headline: EXPEDITORS ADDS CANADA, MEXICO BORDER OFFICES.

text.p: Freight forwarder Expeditors International said it has opened nine offices at key U.S. border crossing with Canada and Mexico.
The Canadian border offices are on the U.S. side of the two international bridges at Buffalo, New York, and the two bridges from Canada at Detroit and Port Huron, Michigan.
Expeditors said 70 percent of U.S. imports from Canada cross in to the country at these gateways.

Along the Mexican border, Expeditors has opened offices in the adjacent cities of Laredo, Texas and Nuevo Laredo, Tamauilpas, Mexico. Other offices are at Nogales, Arizona, gateway to imports from the state of Sonora and its capital, Hermosillo, and San Diego, which covers imports from the Tijuana area of Mexico.
Another office will open shortly in Calexico, California, to service customers importing goods from the export manufacturing zones in Mexicali, capital of Baja California Norte.
Each of the satellite offices provides a full roster of services, including air, road and ocean transport as well as warehousing, distribution, duty drawback and customs release.

Expeditors said the new compliance requirements introduced by the U.S. Customs Modernization Act have the effect of encouraging companies that import from various foreign markets to work with one national freight forwarder rather than specialists in each market. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
